project_name: UPM-2777084 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - MV-18 Actuator Repair for Spare
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: MV-18 Actuator was identified as not allowing chiller #2 to run and as such an emergency service call had to be placed. the actuator was replaced and the one removed is to now be repaired and kept as spare should the same situation arise in the future.
scope_of_work.scope: The manufacture has identified the actuator can be repaired and has provided a quote. it will then be shipped to site and kept as spare to be used if the need arises
scope_of_work.justification: Reliability and redundancy of having an available chiller on standby at all times
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Possible failure of chiller with extended lead time to replace actuator. Note it too 2 weeks recently and an actuator had to be taken from a less critical component to use with manual intervention which is not recommended vs automatic operation.

project_name: UPM-2771910- 275 Viger, Montreal - CHS all the decom storage - After Hours
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled (2):work commencement by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CHS all decommission, remove all powers.
scope_of_work.scope:
1. Disconnect all plugs from the cabinets
2. Turn off (open) the breaks
3. Supply and replace 40 tiles with the solid tiles
4. Remove all whips (De-energized work, this step will process later time)

Note: Work to be performed after hours
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Delay to the customer important project, will impact IBM and customer high visibility projects.

project_name: UPM-2776581 - 245 Consumers Road Toronto - Cleanup of CHS, IBMC, GSA areas for exit of DC at 245Consumers
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Cleanup of CHS, IBMC, GSA areas for exit of DC at 245Consumers and 275Viger
scope_of_work.scope:
Customer (CHS, IBMC, GSA) is vacating DC and we need an estimate to provide:
-224 power whips to be powered down and removed
1- Identify breakers and relevant whips
2- Confirming the cabinets, breakers and whips number
3- Opening breakers
4- Removing whips
5- Installing junction box if it is required
-procurement and replacement of solid 80 wooden core tiles
-procurement and replacement of solid 35 aluminum core straight edge tiles
-procurement and replacement of solid 15 aluminum core tapered corner tiles
-clean the under ground floor by removing wreckages and vacuum the floor ( HYPO Filter Vacuum).
Aside from the above, cabling and miscellaneous infrastructure removal will be performed by Catech and their quotations need to be taken in consideration

245 Consumers Road, Toronto – Areas for Removal :
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 32 – CHS, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 33 – CHS,
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 73 – CHS, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 85 – CHS,
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 86 – CHS, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 87 – CHS,
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 88 – CHS, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 89 – CHS,
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 90 – CHS, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 102 – CHS,
CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 0 – IBMC, CA-4CH-I07-001-01- 12 - IBM GSA
CA-4CH-I07-001-01-71-IBMC, CA-4CH-I07-001-01-94-IBMC
scope_of_work.justification: Normal DC Practice when a customer leaves the facility
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Costs will be absorbed by Kyndryl, this is a customer responsibility

project_name: UPM-2769775 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - Replace Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Sensors in Office Spaces
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Maureen Gerlach (2):rejected by Maureen Gerlach (3):offer submitted by Maureen Gerlach

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Sensors in Office Spaces require replacement. The controller firmware will also require upgrade to fully support the new sensor
scope_of_work.scope:
JCI will provide material and labor to replace the sensors in the below locations;

VAV-01, Conf.Rm 1Y06
VAV-04, BCRS Recovery Suite 1Y08
VAV-07, Cafe/Pantry 1Z12
VAV-10, Recreption Area 1X13
VAV-11, Conf.Rm 1X10
VAV-17, Conf.Rm 1R11
VAV-19, BCRS Recovery Suite 1Y10
VAV-21, ITD/SO, BCRS & Facilities Staff WS 1T13
VAV-22, ITD/SO, BCRS & Facilities Staff WS 1T13
Upgrade VMA controller firmware to fully support the new NS8 Co2 sensor.
scope_of_work.justification: Devices have reached the end of life
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Devices will not work adequately and will be a health and safety issue

project_name: UPM-2777084 - 505 Bayview Dr - Barrie (CLDC) - MV-18 Actuator Repair for Spare
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: MV-18 Actuator was identified as not allowing chiller #2 to run and as such an emergency service call had to be placed. the actuator was replaced and the one removed is to now be repaired and kept as spare should the same situation arise in the future.
scope_of_work.scope: The manufacture has identified the actuator can be repaired and has provided a quote. it will then be shipped to site and kept as spare to be used if the need arises
scope_of_work.justification: Reliability and redundancy of having an available chiller on standby at all times
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Possible failure of chiller with extended lead time to replace actuator. Note it too 2 weeks recently and an actuator had to be taken from a less critical component to use with manual intervention which is not recommended vs automatic operation.

project_name: UPM-2777384 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - EPMS (Powerlogic system) Annual Service
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Annual EPMS service and Maintenance conducted by Schneider canada. Inspection and maintenance of system integrity and overall performance
scope_of_work.scope:
Schneider electric to conduct service as follows:
-PC health
-Database maintenance
-Communications
-Diagrams
-Alarms
-Field Device maintenance
-Backups
scope_of_work.justification:
Electrical Power Management Systems (EPMS) provides visibility into complex and dynamic networks from the electric utility service points and alternate energy sources all the way to critical loads.

Not included in the contract. It is discretionary spend. Recommended by CBRE.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: System health could be overlooked and lead to future faults.
